communityGuidelinesWarning: Please keep in mind that yer Sea Name, profile photo, n' blurb must comply wit' th' Community Guidelines (e.g. no profanity, no adult topics, no insults, etc). If ye 'ave any questions about whether or nah somethin' be appropriate, feel free t' email <%= hrefBlankCommunityManagerEmail %>!
noDescription: Ar! This Habitican hasn't added a description.
noPhoto: Arr! This Habitican hasn't added a photo.
equipmentBonusText: Stat bonuses provided by yer equipped battle gear. See th' Wardrobe tab under Inventory t' select yer battle gear.
classBonusText: Yer class (Warrior, if ye haven't unlocked or selected another class) uses its owns equipment more effectively than gear from other classes. Equipped gear from yer current class gets a 50% boost t' th' Stat bonus it grants.
battleGearText: This be th' gear ye wear into battle; it affects numbers when interactin' with ye tasks.
costumeText: If ye prefer th' look 'o other gear to what ye have equipped, check th' "Use Costume" box to visually don a costume while wearin' ye battle gear underneath.
useCostumeInfo1: Click "Use Costume" t' equip items t' yer avatar without affectin' th' Stats from yer Battle Gear! This means that ye can equip fer th' best Stats on th' left side, 'n dress up yer avatar wit' yer equipment on th' right side.
useCostumeInfo2:
Once ye click "Use Costume" yer avatar will look pretty basic... but don't worry! If ye look on th' left side, ye'll see that yer Battle Gear be still equipped. Next, ye can make thin's fancy! Anythin' ye equip on th' right side won't affect yer Stats, but can make ye look super awesome. Try out different combos, mixin' sets, 'n coordinatin' yer Costume wit' yer pets, mounts, 'n backgrounds.

Got more riddles? Check out th' Costume page on th' wiki. Find th' perfect ensemble? Show it off in th' Costume Carnival fleet or brag in th' Tavern!
costumePopoverText: Click "Use Yer Costume" t' equip items t' yer avatar wi'out affectin' the Stats from yer Battle Gear! This means ye kin dress up yer avatar in wha'ever outfit ye like while still 'avin' yer best Battle Gear equipped.
autoEquipPopoverText: Select this option t' auter-matically equip gear as soon as ye purchase it.
gearAchievement: Ye've earned the "Ultimate Gear" Achievement fer upgradin' t' th' maximum gear set for a class! Ye've attained th' following complete sets:
gearAchievementNotification: Ye've earned th' "Ultimate Gear" Achievement fer upgrading t' th' maximum gear set fer a class!
moreGearAchievements: T' attain more Ultimate Gear badges, change classes on the Settings > Site page n' buy yon new class gear!
armoireUnlocked: Fer more equipment, check out th' Enchanted Armoire! Click on th' Enchanted Armoire Reward fer a random chance at special Equipment! It may also give ye random XP or grub fer yer pets.
ultimGearText: Has upgraded t' th' maximum weapon an' armor set fer the <%= ultClass %> class.
leveledUp: By accomplishin' yer real-life goals, ye've grown t' Level <%= level %>!
noMoreAllocate: Now that ye've hit level 100, ye'll not gain any more Stat Points. Ye kin continue levelin' up, or start a new adventure at level 1 by usin' th' Orb o' Rebirth, which ye kin now get fer free in th' Market.
strText: Strength increases th' chance o' random "critical hits" n' th' Doubloons, Experience, n' drop chance boost from them. It also helps deal damage t' boss monsters.
conText: Constitution reduces th' damage ye take from negative Habits 'n missed Dailies.
perText: Perception increases how much Doubloon ye earn, 'n once ye've unlocked th' Market, increases th' chance 'o findin' items when scorin' tasks.
intText: Intelligence increases how much Experience ye earn, 'n once ye've unlocked Classes, determines ye maximum Mana available fer class abilities.
levelBonusText: Each Stat gets a bonus equal t' 'alf o' (yer Level minus 1).
allocatedPointsText: Stat Points ye've earned an' assigned. Assign yer Points usin' th' Character Build column.
buffsText: Temp'rary Stat bonuses from abilities an' achievements. These wear off at th' end o' yer day. Th' abilities ye've unlocked appear in th' Rewards list o' yer Tasks page.
lvl10ChangeClass: T' change class ye must be at least level 10.
changeClassConfirmCost: Are ye sure ye want to change yer class fer 3 Sapphires?
invalidClass: Ye need t' choose from 'Swashbuckler', 'Scallywag', 'Conjurer', or 'Sawbones'.
levelPopover: Each level earns ye one Point t' assign t' a Stat o' your choice. Ye kin do so manually, or let th' game decide fer ye usin' one o' th' Autermatic Allocation options.
haveUnallocated: Ye've got <%= points %> unallocated Stat Point(s)
autoAllocationPop: Places Points inta Stats accordin' t' yer preferences, when ye level up.
evenAllocationPop: Assigns th' same number o' Points t' each Stat.
classAllocation: Distribute yer Points based on Class
classAllocationPop: Assigns more Points t' th' Stats important t' yer Class.
taskAllocation: Distribute yer Points based on yer task activity
taskAllocationPop: Assigns Points based on th' Strength, Intelligence, Constitution, and Perception categories associated wi' th' tasks ye kermplete.
distributePointsPop: Assigns all unallocated Stat Points according t' th' selected allocation scheme.
warriorText: Warriors score more 'n better "critical hits", which randomly gift bonus Doubloons, Experience, 'n loot chance fer scorin' a task. They also deal heavy damage to boss monsters. Play a Warrior if ye find motivation from unpredictable jackpot-style rewards, or want to dish out th' hurt in boss Quests!
wizardText: Conjurers learn right quick, gainin' Experience an' Levels faster'n other classes. They also get a great deal o' Mana fer usin' special abilities. Play a Conjurer iffen ye enjoy th' tactical game aspects o' Habitica, or iffen ye're strongly motivated by levelin' up an' unlockin' advanced features!
mageText: Conjurers learn right quick, gainin' Experience an' Levels faster'n other classes. They also get a great deal o' Mana fer usin' special abilities. Play a Conjurer iffen ye enjoy th' tactical game aspects o' Habitica, or iffen ye're strongly motivated by levelin' up an' unlockin' advanced features!
rogueText: Scallywags be wantin' riches most of all, gainin' more Doubloons than anyone else, 'n be adept at findin' random items. Their iconic Stealth ability lets 'em duck the consequences o' missed Dailies. Play a Scallywag if ye find strong motivation from Rewards 'n Achievements, strivin' fer loot 'n medals!
healerText: Docs stand impervious against harm, 'n extend that protection to others. Missed Dailies 'n bad Habits don't faze them much, 'n they have ways to recover Health from failure. Play a Doc if ye heartly enjoy assistin' others in ye crew, or if th' idea 'o cheatin' Davy Jones' through harrrd work inspires ye!
optOutOfClassesText: Can't be bothered wiv classes? Want ta choose later? Opt out - ye'll be a warrior wi' no special abilities. Ye kin read about th' class system later on th' wiki an' enable classes at any time under User Icon > Settings.
stealthNewDay: When a new day begins, ye will avoid damage from this many missed Dailies.
streaksFrozenText: Streaks on missed Dailies will not reset at th' end o' th' day.
dieText: Ye've lost a Level, all ye Doubloons, 'n a random piece 'o Equipment. Arise, Habiteer, 'n give a go' again! Curb them negative Habits, be vigilant in completion 'o Dailies, 'n hold Davy Jones' locker at arm's length wit' a Health Potion if ye falter!
sureReset: Are ye sure? This'll reset yer character's class an' allocated Stat Points (you'll get 'em all back ta re-allocate), and costs 3 Gems.
invalidTarget: Ye canna cast a skill on that.
youCastParty: Ye cast <%= spell %> f'r th' crew.
displayNameDescription1: This is what appears in messages you post in the Tavern, guilds, and party chat, along with what is displayed on your avatar. To change it, click the Edit button above. If instead you want to change your username, go to
displayNameDescription3: and look in the Registration section.
chooseClassHeading: Choose yer Class! Or opt out t' choose later.
quickAllocationLevelPopover: Each level earns you one Point to assign to a Stat of your choice. You can do so manually, or let the game decide for you using one of the Automatic Allocation options found in User Icon > Stats.
notEnoughAttrPoints: You don't have enough Stat Points.
classNotSelected: You must select Class before you can assign Stat Points.
chatCastSpellUser: <%= username %> casts <%= spell %> on yon  <%= target %>.
chatCastSpellParty: <%= username %> casts <%= spell %> fer yer crew.
purchasePetItemConfirm: This'll be more'n ye need t' hatch all possible <%= itemText %> pets.  Be ye sure?
purchaseForGold: This'll cost ye <%= cost %>  Doubloons.  Aye or Nay?
